comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
I'm not sure how to reproduce the bug; it seems to happen when you rename projects in the workspace and then close/reopen a project which contains shared launch configs.

More information:
I had a prototype in my workspace. After deciding this was the way to go, I close the prototype, moved it around on the CVS server, checked it out again (with a new project name, say "Foo"), fixed the name in the .project file and then, I've fixed all lauch configs.

The launch configs in the "Foo" work now.

Now, I open an old project "Bar" which did work before. When I do this, I get *one* stacktrace in the error log per shared launch config in "Bar" (*not* Foo!!!). There are two types of stacktrace:

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Launch configuration GktAllTestsMaven at D:\devm2\globus\gkt\code\GktAllTestsMaven.launch does not exist.
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.createDebugException(LaunchManager.java:778)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.getInfo(LaunchManager.java:1175)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.getInfo(LaunchConfiguration.java:356)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.getType(LaunchConfiguration.java:487)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.isValid(LaunchManager.java:1696)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.verifyConfigurations(LaunchManager.java:2014)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.getAllLaunchConfigurations(LaunchManager.java:922)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.launchConfigurationDeleted(LaunchManager.java:1764)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.launchConfigurationAdded(LaunchManager.java:1727)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.projectOpened(LaunchManager.java:1819)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager$LaunchManagerVisitor.visit(LaunchManager.java:344)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.resourceChanged(LaunchManager.java:1923)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:256)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:958)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

and

org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Launch configuration GktAllTestsMaven at D:\devm2\globus\gkt\code\GktAllTestsMaven.launch does not exist.
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.createDebugException(LaunchManager.java:778)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.getInfo(LaunchManager.java:1175)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.getInfo(LaunchConfiguration.java:356)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.getType(LaunchConfiguration.java:487)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.isValid(LaunchManager.java:1696)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.launchConfigurationAdded(LaunchManager.java:1719)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.projectOpened(LaunchManager.java:1819)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager$LaunchManagerVisitor.visit(LaunchManager.java:344)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:67)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.ResourceDelta.accept(ResourceDelta.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager.resourceChanged(LaunchManager.java:1923)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.notify(NotificationManager.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager.broadcastChanges(NotificationManager.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.broadcastPostChange(Workspace.java:256)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:958)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

In both cases, Eclipse insists that the file doesn't exist. When I open the .launch file in an editor and save it, I get the same error which means the file exists and Eclipse can read and write it.

Next, I had a look in the Run dialog. In there, many launch configs of several projects are duplicated all of a sudden. Namely, all *shared* launch configs have been duplicated. All local launch configs are *not* affected.

When I delete one of the dupes, it's twin vanishes as well. I think this is because the file in the project is deleted. What I don't understand: Why is Eclipse showing *two* entries for *one* file?

Now, I resurrected the file from CVS. It did not show up anymore in the Run dialog and again, I got one error per launch file in "Bar".

I tried to close "Bar". This worked but now, many strange things happen:

1. Files from "Bar" stay open. Normally, Eclipse would close the editors with the project.
2. I again tried to delete a duplicate and resurrect it from CVS. Once more, I got one error per launch file in "Bar" despite the fact that "Bar" is not open.

My guess is that Eclipse keeps a cache with Launch configs somewhere and somehow, this cache can get out of sync when projects are renamed and the cache is not rebuilt when projects are closed/opened.

This bug is probably related to Bug 14202 and Bug 148620.

Followup: I tried to restart Eclipse and it didn't help. The cache must be persistent in the workspace.

I deleted the launch filed in Bar, again no cache update.

I resurrected the launch files in Bar. The errors were back, again no cache update.

I tried to reproduce but the steps are not very clear.  Closing projects, renaming projects, changing project names in files, etc. all demonstrated the expected results.

Can you please try and create a simpler test case and explain the steps more clearly.  Include what projects are in your workspace, note if they are open/closed, and if they have shared configs.  I don't know what you mean by "moved it around on the CVS server".

Thanks.
Note, we're testing on 3.3 - are you able to try on 3.3 to see if the problem exists there?

I have a very big workspace with projects of my employer which I cannot disclose. Since I'm developing software for production, I can't easily run 3.3. I will consider this again when 3.3 is released and the bug couldn't be fixed in 3.2.

"moved it around on the CVS server" means I logged into the CVS server and manually moved a project from one tree (/lab) to another (/prod).

I understand that you cannot reproduce the bug. I do not thing I could easily reproduce it without some idea what might be going on. I had this bug maybe 2-3 in the last 12 months. At the moment, my best bet is to took at the place were Eclipse caches the shared launch configs and find out how I can force it to recreate this cache (for example, by deleting a file in the workspace .metadata).

I think that the information might be somewhere below here: .metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\ in one of the .tree files. Maybe they aren't updated when I open/close projects? Can I safely delete them?

Okay, I might be on the trail of the bug. Can you try this:

1. Create a project Foo
2. Create a second project Bar *inside* Foo (so you'll have Foo/.project and Foo/Bar/.project)
3. Create a launch config in Bar

Now, you'll have *two* launch configs, one from Foo/Bar and one from Bar. Until now, everything is fine.

Now *close* Foo.

You should now get org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException's in the error log.

They go away as soon as you either open Foo or delete Foo (leaving the contents alone, of course).

I guess that the launch code searches all projects for .launch files, no matter if the project is open or not!

Eclipse does not allow nesting of projects, so I am not sure how to reproduce this? Likely the cause is that we don't get a close delta from the nested project, so when we ask the nested config for its info, the location does not exist as far as the workspace is concerned, causing us to throw an exception stating that the location does not exist.
I've just tried to create a test case at home and failed. I'll try to create a test project for this bug on Monday.

Created an attachment (id=71183)
Eclipse project which shows the problem

- Import the project on Windows
- Now, you have Foo
- Select File / Import ...
- Select Existing Project
- Select "Bar" inside of Foo and click OK
- Select project Bar
- Run As / JUnit Testcase
- Close Bar

You will now have a launch config "Bar" in the run menu despite the fact that Bar is closed. If you run this, you'll get "Launch configuration Bar references closed project Bar" in the error log.

I found that sharing this launch config will fix the bug but I have other projects where I see two launch configs if I import the parent and I still get errors for running them, when I close the parent. Unfortunately, I haven't found a way to reproduce this. In my workbench, it is stable (happens every time) but I can't export it and send it to you for the reasons mentioned above.

Using the example provided it works for me. If I close the project the configuration does not show up anywhere, unless I turn off closed project launch filtering.

what do the filtering options for launch configurations say on the Run/Debug > Launching > Launch Configurations preference page?

I have the first three (Filter config. in closed projects, ... in deleted/missing projects, Apply window working set(s)) active and "Filter checked configuration types" is inactive.

Did you try my test project with 3.3 or 3.2?

I ran it in both. I actually stumbled accross a bug in JUnits' code for their resource mapping (bug 193200), which would inadvertently set the resource mapping to null, meaning it will pass through all filters regardless of them being on or not. 

JUnit has applied a fix, and you should try the next build after today to see if it fixes the problem.

How much trouble will I have when I switch back and forth between 3.2 and 3.3 using the same workspace directory? I'm pretty sure that building up a new (clean) workspace will "fix" the bug.

I'm currently not working on production code, so I can afford to ruin my workspace but I don't want to lose the bug.
I have now tried with 3.3 and the bug is gone there. OTOH, I don't have all my old plugins installed, yet. I'll keep an eye on this.
